#Text=Crisis at stricken Japan nuclear plant escalates to level of Chernobyl ; six killed in aftershock
#Text=Tuesday , April 12 , 2011
#Text=A new magnitude 6.6 aftershock yesterday triggered a mudslide which left six people dead .
#Text=Image : United States Geological Survey .
#Text=The crisis at a stricken nuclear plant on the northeast coast of Japan is now as severe as the disaster at Chernobyl in 1986 , officials have said .
#Text=Radiation is continuing to leak from the plant , which was damaged during the devastating magnitude 9.0 earthquake and tsunami last month , which left thousands dead .
#Text=Japanese authorities have warned the crisis is now a " major accident " with " wider consequences " than previously thought .

column1: #Text=A spokesperson for NISA , the Japanese government nuclear authority , said officials had upgraded the crisis to a level seven on the International Nuclear Event Scale — the same applied to the Chernobyl disaster — because of a number of factors , including the detection of radiation in crops .
#Text=" We have upgraded the severity level to seven as the impact of radiation leaks has been widespread from the air , vegetables , tap water and the ocean , " he said .
#Text=We have upgraded the severity level to seven as the impact of radiation leaks has been widespread from the air , vegetables , tap water and the ocean . — Spokesperson , NISA
#Text=TEPCO , the operator of the plant , has warned radiation was continuing to leak from the site and the magnitude of the crisis could exceed that of Chernobyl .
#Text=Despite this , Japanese nuclear safety officials have insisted the leakage of radiation was small compared to the devastated plant in the former Soviet Union .
#Text=" In terms of volume of radioactive materials released , our estimate shows it is about ten percent of what was released by Chernobyl , " one nuclear official said .
#Text=File : Fukushima I by Digital Globe 2 . jpg
#Text=The devastated Fukushima I nuclear power plant pictured five days after the initial earthquake .
#Text=Image : DigitalGlobe .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=The news comes as a new blow after another powerful aftershock yesterday which left at least six people dead after they were killed in a mudslide in the city of Iwaki .
#Text=The landslide , which destroyed numerous homes , was triggered by a magnitude 6.6 aftershock which came exactly a month after the 9.0 magnitude earthquake .
#Text=Fire officials in the city said three people had already been rescued and taken to hospital , and emergency workers were working to free an unknown number of others .

#Text=The International Nuclear Events Scale ; the accidents at the Fukushima I have been elevated to level seven , the highest level on the scale , putting it on par with the Chernobyl disaster , originally the accidents were rated at level five , the same level of the Three Mile Island accident .
#Text=Image : Silver Spoon .

#Text=Workers at the damaged Fukushima nuclear plant returned after they were briefly evacuated following the earthquake , and officials issued tsunami warnings for the northeast coast which were later cancelled .
#Text=Workers have been fighting a desperate battle to prevent the reactors from overheating and entering meltdown .
#Text=Raging fires burned into the night after the earthquake , and TEPCO reported widespread power outages ; hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses had power cut off .
#Text=Reports of the change in severity at the damaged nuclear plant followed the announcement that the exclusion zone around the site was to be expanded .
#Text=A spokesperson for the government confirmed the radius of the zone would be expanded to include another five communities over the next several weeks .
#Text=He stressed there was " no need to evacuate immediately " but said concerns had been raised over health risks from the leaking radiation .

#Text=The new development at the plant and the aftershock are new blows to a country wounded after the massive earthquake in March , which caused a tsunami that washed away whole towns and villages along the country 's northeast coast .
#Text=Thousands of bodies have been recovered , and many more are still unaccounted for , many left under mounds of rubble or washed out to sea .
#Text=More than 150,000 people remain displaced , living in emergency shelters .
#Text=Through our own efforts and with the help of the global community , Japan will recover and come back even stronger .
#Text=— Naoto Kan , prime minister of Japan
#Text=Before the aftershock struck yesterday , survivors of the first earthquake marked the time it hit a month ago with a moment of silence across the country .
#Text=Writing to seven international newspapers , Naoto Kan , the Japanese prime minister , expressed his gratitude to people globally for their support .
#Text=" Through our own efforts and with the help of the global community , Japan will recover and come back even stronger .

#Text= With this in our hearts , we now stand together dedicated to rebuilding the nation . "
